attributes.action: Use HS2 money to improve cycling networks
attributes.additional_details:
Too many cyclists are dying on UK roads.

Cycling routes in the UK's towns and cities need to be made safer.

Scrap the unpopular HS2 scheme and instead use the money to improve cycling safety across the UK by:

- Creating separate cycling lanes so that cyclists do not need to cycle on busy roads
- Improve junction and roundabout layouts with cyclists in mind
- Improve existing cycling networks and maps
- Building more bike storage at train and bus stations
